business.headline: Mutual funds are on the rise again. Check out these 5 bets in 2025Choosing the right mutual fund depends on how much risk you're comfortable with and how long you plan to invest.

Oyo delays IPO attempt for 3rd time as largest shareholder opposes: ReportIndia's Nifty 50 index has risen about 3% in 2025 so far, but it's still over 7% below its all-time high from October last year. This market volatility has affected several companies.

UPI witnesses small dip in April, but yearly growth remains strongAccording to data from the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI processed 17.89 billion transactions in April, which is about 2.2% less than March's 18.30 billion.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".
Sensex ends 260 points higher, Nifty above 24,300; Adani Ports gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 259.75 points to close at 80,501.99, while the NSE Nifty50 ended just 12.50 points higher at 24,346.70.
Zoho halts $700 million chip manufacturing plan. Here's whyZoho, started in 1996, is known for offering affordable business software and services to companies around the world.

Vizhinjam port inaugurated: What makes it a strategic gem for IndiaThe Vizhinjam port has a natural sea depth of around 20 metres, making it suitable for very large ships without the need for deep digging, which is common in other ports.

UPI payments to get faster from June 16: What it means for youNPCI shared in its latest circular stated that from June 16, 2025, UPI users can expect quicker responses when checking the status of a transaction or reversing a payment.

Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.

Zomato shares rise despite 78% drop in Q4 profit. Should you buy, hold or sell?Eternal posted revenue of Rs 5,830 crore, broadly in line with analyst estimates. EBITDA margin slipped to 1.2%—falling short of expectations—but the company managed to maintain stable contribution margins in both food delivery and quick commerce.
Adani Group stocks rise up to 5%. Here's whyAdani Enterprises' shares climbed more than 2% on Friday after the company reported an increase in its net profit for the January–March quarter.
Sensex gains 900 points. 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 867.48 points at 81,109.72 around 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 247.90 points to trade at 24,582.10.

Sensex, Nifty soar as trade deal hopes lift sentiment; FII buying boosts rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex went past the 81,000 mark while NSE Nifty50 was close to surpassing 24,600 level as Dalal Street surged in early trade.

Ather Energy IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateThe total number of bids received was 7,67,49,068 against the offer of 5,11,22,370 shares. Through the IPO, Ather Energy raised Rs 2,980.76 crore.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty rise or fall on May 2?In the last two sessions, both Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower. There was uncertainty among investors due to rising tension between India and Pakistan. However, markets are expected to start the day on a stronger note.

Stocks to watch: Eternal, Tata Motors, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, MahindraBoth the Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower in the last session, as cautious sentiment prevailed among investors over rising India-Pakistan tension.

Air India expects $600 million in losses if Pak airspace shut for a year: ReportThe closure of Pakistani airspace for a year would result in losses of USD 600 million for the country's national carrier, Air India, news agency PTI reported, citing sources. The airline has sought the government's assistance to address the challenges.

RBI makes PRAVAAH portal mandatory for financial institutions starting May 1The PRAVAAH portal provides all necessary forms, along with simple instructions. Users can submit their application, track its progress, and even get alerts.
GST collections hit record Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April, up 12.6%In March, GST collections stood at Rs 1.96 lakh crore, showing a 9.9% rise from the same period last year.

Nithin Kamath exposes this scam using his name to dupe investors. Details hereZerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has urged investors to stay alert, always check the source, and never act on random financial advice sent on messaging apps.

Adani Ports Q4 results: Net profit soars 50%, revenue up 23%The company reported a 50% rise in its consolidated net profit, which stood at Rs 3,023 crore. This is an increase from Rs 2,025 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

From ATM charges to LPG prices: 5 key financial changes to know in May 2025Starting May 1, taking cash out from an ATM after your free monthly limit will cost you Rs 23 per transaction, up from the current Rs 21.
Zomato Q4 earnings: What to expect from Eternal's January-March resultsAnalysts expect mixed numbers for the fourth quarter, mainly due to expected higher losses from its quick commerce arm, Blinkit.

'Gold doesn't always glitter': This CA's post might change your mindA CA pointed out a combination of global shocks, like COVID-19, wars, inflation fears, and central bank purchases, which all contributed to the price spike in the yellow metal since 2020.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

Ather Energy IPO: Step-by-step guide to check allotment status. See latest GMPThe electric scooter maker's public offer was just fully subscribed by the end of the final day of bidding, suggesting investors were not keen to put their money on another EV scooter maker, after Ola Electric's shares have not performed well since its market debut.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Sensex, Nifty holiday: Are stock markets open for trading today?There are also no market holidays in the months of June and July 2025, so investors can expect uninterrupted trading during this period.

After Mother Dairy, Amul hikes milk prices by Rs 2 per litreAfter Mother Dairy, Amul has also hiked the prices of its milk up to 2rs per litre. The new prices will come into effect from tomorrow, i.e., May 1.

'Cash is king,' says Mark Mobius amid trade war fears, backs India over ChinaVeteran investor Mark Mobius believes that the uncertainty around the trade wars makes it risky to invest right now. However, he does see hope in countries like India, which he says could benefit as global supply chains shift away from China.
Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 46.14 points to end at 80,242.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 1.75 points to close at 24,334.20.

Can gold retain its glitter as Dalal Street gets back its glow?Just a week ago, gold was trading at record levels due to global uncertainty. Concerns over trade tensions, US tariffs, and geopolitical issues had pushed investors towards gold, a common choice during uncertain times.

New wave of IPOs is coming. Is Dalal Street ready?Tata Capital, PhonePe, and Zepto are also said to be in the pipeline. Financial firms like HDB Financial Services and Hero FinCorp are planning to raise Rs 12,500 crore and Rs 3,668 crore, respectively.

Rakuten to invest over $100 million in India, plans to boost hiring by 8%Rakuten currently employs 4,000 people in India, 90% of whom are tech staff, and plans to recruit people who it considers "power users" of AI.

RBI raises ATM charges to Rs 23 from May 1: Know the details herePeople living in metro cities would get three free transactions per month, while those living in non-metro areas would get five free transactions per month.

Rupee jumps to highest level in 2025. Check factors behind strong rallyThe Indian rupee reached its highest level of 2025, driven by foreign inflows and exporter dollar sales. Optimism over US-India trade talks and a weakening US dollar further supported the currency's rally.

'If we look closely...': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu on finding rural talentZoho's CEO, Sridhar Vembu, believes that India's path to development must include creating jobs and opportunities in smaller towns and villages.

entertainment.headline: Veteran actor Mumtaz, SRK's first crush, says no to playing his mother in filmsVeteran actor Mumtaz said she won't play Shah Rukh Khan's mother in films, as she wants roles that match her age and looks. She appreciated SRK's praise but added that she chooses roles that fit her style and image.

Fawad Khan, Atif Aslam's Instagram blocked in India after Hania Aamir, MahiraPakistani artistes Fawad Khan and Atif Aslam's Instagram accounts have been blocked in India after Hania Aamir and Mahira Khan. This comes after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

Akshay Kumar, Saif to reunite for edge-of-the-seat thriller after 17 years: ReportActors Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan are set to reunite on screen after 17 years. The two shared screen space in 'Tashan' (2008).

Mika says Salman is different person after 2 drinks, recalls him ignoring Meet BrosMika Singh talked about Salman Khan's mood swings, the person he becomes after '2 drinks', and how he ignored Meet Bros. During an event after having dinner with them the night before.

When Steven Spielberg met Kareena at a restaurant: You are that girl from 3 IdiotsKareena Kapoor recalled at WAVES 2025 that Steven Spielberg once recognised her as the "3 Idiots girl" and praised the film. She also expressed that she is open to international projects.

Complaint against Vijay Deverakonda for comparing Pahalgam to tribal clashesA complaint has been filed against actor Vijay Deverakonda for his remarks against the tribal communities. This came after the actor condemned the Pahalgam attack.

Actor Jeremy Renner rejects Hawkeye Season 2: They offered me half the moneyActor Jeremy Renner rejected the 'Hawkeye' Season 2 proposal offered by Disney due to salary issues. He hinted that Disney offered him a lower salary because of the life-threatening snow-plow accident he suffered back in 2023.

Solo Leveling Season 3 on cards? Crunchyroll President 'hopes so'Solo Leveling, which has become the most-watched anime on Crunchyroll in the first quarter of 2025, will get a third season soon. Crunchyroll President Rahul Purini said that the team of the anime are trying to find the right time to get started on the next season.

Malayalam actor Vishnu Prasad dies of liver diseaseMalayalam film and television actor Vishnu Prasad has passed away at the age of 49 in Kochi. He was undergoing treatment for liver-related issues and was awaiting a transplant.

Kull review: This game of thrones between siblings is dark and grittyReleased-Fri May 02, 2025Kull review: 'Kull-The Legacy Of Raisingghs', starring Amol Parashar, Nimrat Kaur and Ridhi Dogra, is now streaming on JioHotstar. The eight-episode drama explores how far a royal family will go when power is the ultimate prize. Read our review here.

Saif Ali Khan says he apologised to son Taimur for making him watch AdipurushSaif Ali Khan recently revealed showing 'Adipurush' to his elder son, Taimur. The actor revealed he apologised to the little one after making him sit through the film.

Timothee Chalamet-Kylie Jenner turn heads with their PDA at NBA gamesTimothee Chalamet and Kylie Jenner are back in town with their PDA. The couple was clicked at the NBA Playoff game, enjoying courtside in a Los Angeles stadium.

Your business is just inside India: Oppenheimer producer on India's global reachHollywood producer Charles Roven stated that Indian films often fail to go global because they primarily focus on local audiences. Actor Aamir Khan agreed, adding that India needs more cinema screens to truly unlock its film industry's potential.

Aamir Khan blames lack of theatres for Bollywood's box office strugglesDuring a discussion at WAVES Summit 2025, Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan opened up about the lack of theatres in India, calling it a long-standing issue Bollywood has faced over decades.

8 chapters on Mughals: R Madhavan slams history books for ignoring South legacyAmid the NCERT row, actor R Madhavan called out the education policymakers for dedicating 'eight chapters to Mughals' and excluding the legacy of the Southern kingdoms from history textbooks. He also mentioned that the curriculum gives less importance to the history of Jainism, Hinduism, and Buddhism.

Actor Nani weighs in on Telugu vs Malayalam film debate | ExclusiveIn an exclusive chat with India Today, actor Nani shared his views on the differences between Telugu and Malayalam cinema, highlighting the box office success of Telugu films and the quality of Malayalam cinema. He appreciated the passion of both Telugu and Malayali audiences for films.

Esha Deol wishes her 'world' Dharmendra-Hema Malini on 45th wedding anniversaryVeteran Bollywood couple Dharmendra and Hema Malini marked their 45th wedding anniversary on May 2. On the occasion, their daughter Esha Deol shared a heartfelt family picture to wish her 'world' on the big day.

Javed Akhtar to those 'harassing Kashmiris': You are validating Pak propagandaPoet and lyricist Javed Akhtar recalled the Kargil War with Pakistan and blamed the neighbours for never wanting peace with India. He spoke at an event and slammed those 'harassing Kashmiris' after the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

SRK roasts Karan Johar's parenting and sports skills: You get trained firstAt the WAVES Summit 2025, Shah Rukh Khan playfully roasted Karan Johar during a fun-filled chat about parenting and attending their children's school events. Their friendship and fun banter stole the show, leaving the audience in splits.

general news.headline: Dream becoming reality: PM Modi calls Amaravati foundation of Andhra's aspirationsPrime Minister Modi calls Amaravati the key to fulfilling Andhra Pradesh's dreams of modern development, with the city's progress set to transform the state into a hub for future technologies and growth.

Many will lose sleep: PM Modi's jibe at INDIA bloc ft. Shashi TharoorAt the Vizhinjam port inauguration in Kerala, Prime Minister Narendra Modi used Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's presence to take a political dig at the Opposition's INDIA bloc, stirring fresh speculation.

Trump announces revoking Harvard's tax-exempt status: 'It's what they deserve'US President Donald Trump announced the revocation of Harvard University's tax-exempt status after the university refused to comply with his administration's demands for governance, policy, and campus activism reforms.

Pawan Kalyan does a Modi, switches to English on Pahalgam: PM has assured...With his switch from Telugu to English, Pawan Kalyan ensured that his message on the Pahalgam terror attack reached the people of Andhra and beyond.

When terrorists hijacked ODI in Srinagar, attacked Kapil's DevilsSrinagar was making its international cricket debut with an India-West Indies ODI in the Sher-e-Kashmir Stadium. It was October 1983, and India, led by Kapil Dev, had recently won the World Cup. The Pakistan-backed terrorists chanted anti-India slogans, dug up the pitch during the break, and attacked Kapil's Devils with stones and bottles. The match became more than a footnote in the chapter on terrorism in Kashmir.

Right to be heard: Court notice to Sonia Gandhi, Rahul in National Herald caseDelhi's Rouse Avenue Court on Thursday issued a notice to former Congress Chairperson Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, and other proposed accused to be heard on the question of cognisance of the chargesheet filed against them in the National Herald case.

BJP stole Rahul's thunder with caste census. But there are other advantages tooUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's casual announcement at the end of a Cabinet briefing that the upcoming census would include an enumeration of different castes across the country took the Opposition completely off guard.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".

Mika says Salman is different person after 2 drinks, recalls him ignoring Meet BrosMika Singh talked about Salman Khan's mood swings, the person he becomes after '2 drinks', and how he ignored Meet Bros. During an event after having dinner with them the night before.

Tension grips Karnataka coastal city after ex-Bajrang Dal member hacked to deathA former Bajrang Dal member with a long criminal record was killed in a sword attack near Mangaluru, Karnataka. The incident created tension in the area, leading the police to heighten security, amid citywide bandh called by Hindu outfit VHP. s

Don't think it's a secret: Bilawal Bhutto on Pakistan's links with terror groupsBilawal Bhutto's remarks came during an interview with Sky News, where he responded to a question regarding earlier comments by Pakistan's Defence Minister Khwaja Asif on the country's link to terror groups.

Babar Azam, Rizwan's Instagram accounts blocked in IndiaBabar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan and Instagram accounts of Pakistani cricketers have been blocked in India after 26 people died in the Pahalgam attack on April 22.

Kull review: This game of thrones between siblings is dark and grittyReleased-Fri May 02, 2025Kull review: 'Kull-The Legacy Of Raisingghs', starring Amol Parashar, Nimrat Kaur and Ridhi Dogra, is now streaming on JioHotstar. The eight-episode drama explores how far a royal family will go when power is the ultimate prize. Read our review here.

Odisha Class 10 result 2025 declared, pass percentage at 94.69%: Direct linkBSE Odisha has released the 10th board, Madhyama, and open school results. Students can check the Odisha Board Class 10 scores on bseodisha.ac.in, orissaresults.nic.in, DigiLocker, or via SMS from 6 pm.

Amaravati revived: All you need to know about Andhra Pradesh's capital in makingAfter years of uncertainty, development of Andhra Pradesh's capital Amaravati is back on track. Revived by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu's 2024 return to power and fresh funding, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will relaunch the construction work.

Pak hackers try to breach Indian websites, wave of cyber attack attempts foiledIn the wake of the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, Pakistan-sponsored hacker groups unleashed a wave of cyber assaults on Indian websites, which were swiftly neutralised.

When Steven Spielberg met Kareena at a restaurant: You are that girl from 3 IdiotsKareena Kapoor recalled at WAVES 2025 that Steven Spielberg once recognised her as the "3 Idiots girl" and praised the film. She also expressed that she is open to international projects.

Sterilise people accused of 'love jihad', says Bhopal MP amid rising casesBhopal MP Alok Sharma's remarks come after cases of Hindu students being targeted by a gang accused of 'love jihad' came to light last month.

India plans twin financial strikes on Pakistan to curb terror funding: SourcesIn the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack, sources said India is likely to actively pursue getting Pakistan back onto the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) grey list.

Ullu app pulls Ajaz Khan-hosted show 'House Arrest' amid row over obscene clipThe National Commission for Women (NCW) issued notices to Ullu CEO Vibhu Agarwal and Aizaz Khan, summoning them to appear before it on May 9, 2025. The action comes after a short clip from the show, dated April 29, went viral, allegedly showing the host coercing female participants into enacting intimate scenes on camera.

Bengaluru CEO says he raised Rs 120 crore but was still 'broke, worried about rent'Harsh Pokharna, co-founder and CEO of digital ledger app OkCredit, shared a post on LinkedIn in which he wrote about the personal struggles faced by startup founders.

Top fighters, night landing and a highway: Air Force's mega show of strengthThis is the first road runway in India equipped to handle both day and night landings of fighter jets, thanks to advanced lighting and navigation systems installed on-site.

As war fears rise, ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's supporters press for his releaseThe hashtag #ReleaseKhanForPakistan featured in more than 3 lakh posts. Another trending tag, #FreeImranKhan was used in over 35,000 posts by 2,500 unique users over a week ending April 29.

Siddaramaiah says he also received threat calls, asks police to trace culpritsKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah revealed that, similar to Speaker UT Khader, he has also received threatening phone calls. He confirmed that he has alerted the police and called for action against those responsible.

sports.headline: Rohit Sharma gifts bat to RR's Shane Bond's son, sends hilarious messageRohit Sharma's post-match gesture stole the spotlight as he gifted a signed bat to Shane Bond for his son, along with a cheeky message, after leading MI to a thumping win that ended RR's playoff hopes in IPL 2025.

Babar Azam, Rizwan's Instagram accounts blocked in IndiaBabar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan and Instagram accounts of Pakistani cricketers have been blocked in India after 26 people died in the Pahalgam attack on April 22.

Watch: MS Dhoni fangirl ecstatic after CSK captain gives her autographed jerseyIPL 2025: A fangirl of MS Dhoni was over the moon after the Chennai Super Kings' skipper gave her an autographed jersey. CSK have already been eliminated from the competition.

Sudharsan knows English conditions, should be picked for Test tour: ShastriFormer Indian cricketer Ravi Shastri backed Sai Sudharsan to make the squad for the England Test series given his familiarity with the playing conditions on English soil.

Virat Kohli T20I retirement: RCB star explains why he decided to leave formatVirat Kohli explained why he decided to step away from T20Is after the World Cup in 2024. Kohli was the star for India in the final against South Africa.

KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane eager to make India return: Fire, hunger still thereAjinkya Rahane reiterated his desire to make a comeback to the Indian team once again. Rahane has been KKR's best batter this season in the ongoing IPL 2025 season.

Sreesanth handed 3-year suspension over remarks in Sanju Samson rowSreesanth has been suspended for three years by the Kerala Cricket Association (KCA) for his false and derogatory remarks over Sanju Samson's omission from India's Champions Trophy squad.

Jack Draper joins Rafael Nadal in rare ranking club after semis berthMadrid Open 2025: Britain's Jack Draper is set to become only the second left-hander this century to enter the top five of the ATP rankings. Draper will face Lorenzo Musetti in the semis after beating Matteo Arnaldi.

Did SRH start to doubt their aggressive batting approach? Matthew Hayden reactsMatthew Hayden feels that SRH started to doubt their all-aggressive approach during the IPL 2025 season. SRH have struggled during the campaign this year after catching the imagination of everyone last year.

If India need me for England Test series, I am prepared: Cheteshwar PujaraCheteshwar Pujara has said that he is ready to make a return to the Indian Test team for the upcoming England tour, if his services are required. India will face England in a five-match Test series.

SRH struggling with an unstable middle order? Daniel Vettori respondsIPL 2025, GT vs SRH: In the press conference before the match against the Gujarat Titans, head coach Daniel Vettori talked about the form of the Sunrisers Hyderabad batting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
